title: Oman invited for Hockey World League Round 1 in Turkey
text:
Oman invited for Hockey World League Round 1 in Turkey A file photo of an Oman-Iran match during the HWL Round 1 last year Muscat Daily staff writer October 11, 2015 
Oman is one of the seven teams invited by the International Hockey Federation (FIH) to take part in the 2016-17 Hockey World League (HWL) Round 1, which will be held in Antalya, Turkey. 
The FIH on Friday announced the nine venues that will host the opening round, with Turkey and Peru being given the competition's hosting rights for the first time. 
Taking place in the summer of 2016, the joint men’s and women’s events will be held in Accra (Ghana), Singapore, Prague (Czech Republic), Salamanca (Mexico) and Chiclayo (Peru), while a location in Oceania will be confirmed at a later date. 
Besides the joint men's and women's events, a separate women’s competition will take place in Cambrai (France), while Antalya and Glasgow (Scotland) will host men’s competitions. 
The dates for all the Round 1 events are being worked out. 
So far, Oman, which is ranked 21st in the world, has been invited along with Austria, Azerbaijan, Cyprus, Qatar, UAE and hosts Turkey for the Antalya tournament. 
Rankings from the Round 1 competitions will determine if the teams will qualify for Round 2, which will take place in early 2017. 
Composed of four rounds and played over two years, the HWL takes place in venues around the world. The competition gives the smaller hockey-playing nations an opportunity to progress to the next round and so on, with the added incentive of Olympic or World Cup qualification. 
Earlier, the FIH announced the names of six nations that will host the HWL Round 2 events - including Trinidad & Tobago, Ireland, Bangladesh, Canada, Spain and Malaysia. 
The 2016-17 HWL will decide which teams will qualify, alongside the continental champion and hosts, for the FIH World Cups in 2018 in India (men) and England (women). 
All teams participating in the HWL will also receive FIH world ranking points, which could prove crucial when it comes to qualification for other events. The winners will qualify for the 2018 Champions Trophy in Argentina (women) and the Netherlands (men). Similar content
